title: How is it to Study in Amity University? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Amity” means friendliness and indeed the college justifies the meaning of its name. After reading the below points I will leave it on to you to decide whether Amity University is a good or bad university. I'm writing the pros and cons keeping in Universitie’s Noida campus. Pros: Most people will talk about campus and its life. But the best thing in Amity is its faculities. 4 out of 7 professors from my course were from various IIM's. All professors were professional,well-versed and sound with the subject they were teaching.Curriculum is same in every college. But what makes Amity curriculum stand out is its extra credit courses which are manditory most of the times. Courses like Human value community outreach(HVCO), Military Training Camp(MTC) and various other Non-Teaching Credit Courses(NTCC) help student learn alot. They get a totally new perspective. Social Science subject also helps student deal with social pressure and tension.The term Ragging is totally absent from Amity's campuses. Amity is an Anti-Ragging campus. And by chance If some ragging case has been found, the perpetrator is chastised severly.Amity’s Campus is sumptuous. It has various canteen that are both student friendly and hygienic. Library, classrooms, sports complex all are good. Gym is also fine. Campus is clean and serene. Campus has diversity.All the events whether it is freshers,annual fest, convocation is carried out in a proper and lively manner every year.Scholarship is giving to people who scored more than 90% in board(12th) exam, it is also given to national players.Rest online e-portal is now ubiqutous nowdays. Cons: There is an entrance exam or interview(dependong the upon the course which you opt for) for the university in which 95% of the students pass, as it is not that tough. If someone has required money he or she can get Admission through Sponsored candidate, who pay some 70–80% more fee than non- sponsored category candidate. Since purging is not done in a stringent manner. This makes college crowd vulnerable to non deserving candidates.As its a private university the fee for certain courses might burn a hole in many people's pocket.Many students come from affluent or opluent family they smoke, take drugs, disrespect teacher and all. To be candid these things are present in every college, but dont know why Amity name is tarnished always.The complusory Foreign Business Language( FBL) sometimes put unwanted onus on the students.Hope my answer will help you extrapolate whether “Amity” is a good college or not. Feel free to ask if you have any further doubt.

A2A The education environment for Amity is somewhat a mixed bag altogether. Some departments of Amity University are doing quite well like Business School, Law School, Foreign Languages School, Dept of Psychology, Nursing but then there are other depts like Basic Sciences, Engineering and Technology, Forensics, Animation etc which are present just cause the sake of it. Engineering and Technology is the worst and not the worth the money. Infact most courses are not except MBA and School of Foreign Languages. You won't find very competitive peers in your group, one or two might be exceptions. Everybody is busy with other activities and chilling out and coming to classes just for attendance. Faculties are also mixed bunches. There are very good, talented and caring ones. And there are ones who don't give a shit about you or the university. If you're going to stay in the hostel be ready to face alot of restrictions and unjustified rules which don't make sense. Apart from all these studies are pretty normal. If you can understand what's being taught in class and do some self study you won't go below 8.5 CGPA and if you do a lil bit of hard work 9+ CGPA. If want to know about people then, there are about 50–60 percent locals and remaining are from the rest of India. You'll find a major chuck of South Indians (don't know why they prefer Amity). Locals include cool decent people, uncivilized hooligans from nearby villages and obviously rich spoiled brats. So according to me it's an experience altogether. Good Luck if you're joining Amity!

Hello, I'm pursuing MSc statistics from Amity University Noida. I don't know much about other departments but Statistics department is pretty good. All the faculties are very supportive and encouraging. But the professors are quite syllabus oriented and they really need to put in more effort to get students in the research field. Amity University nowadays has become a brand in private institutions so opting for some decent courses wouldn't be regrettable. The university is bit harsh on your pocket as the fees is quite high. But the fees will be utilised if you know how to swim in the ocean of opportunities in the campus. It is a good place for studious kids because the attendance system makes sure you won't miss a class. However, that is also the biggest flaw. 😂 Amity guarantees 100% placement but the chances are that if you don't put an effort, you may remain unplaced. Other than curricular, you can indulge yourself in co-curricular and extra curricular activities, events like- Amity youth fest and Sangathan are perfect events to polish your skills. Amity provides a platform to showcase your talent. The infrastructure holds a world class central library that is a visual treat once you enter it. It has squash court, shooting range, basketball court, gym, swimming pool and THE ARCADIA for indoor games. It has cheerful environment and you will never get bored in the campus, the crowd is much alike the one you saw in Student of the year movie😂. It has cafeteria for each block, food chain such as subway, Domino's, CCD, dosa plaza etc for appetite comfort. Rest I am enjoying here. So you can choose this college.

I did my B.Com (hons.) from Amity University. Infrastructure- As it states , it has an amazing infrastructure that was built initially but as every batch enrolls and pass out , they leave their mark by showing their love on infrastructure. :P Faculty- Some are amazing ; have in-depth knowledge of their subject and some are worst. Wi-Fi :- Don’t depend on wi-fi , always have net pack in your phone. Sometimes you may get good speed but never depend on Wi-Fi. It won’t work when you need it the most. Students:- You will find every variety of student over there , extroverts , handsome , beautiful, introverts, bimbos, studious , always high , extreme introverts with whom you may never talk in your entire duration of course, high maintenance, Apple’s brand ambassador, teacher’s pet etc etc. but you will make great friends over here because no matter from where they are or what they are , you all ended up in Amity only. Of course, I hated Amity from my step in that campus and I still hate it. But “ No matter how good or bad Amity was, I miss it.”

Amity university Noida has a huge campus and provides all necessary adminities to its students. In market name of Amity is not that good solely because it's intake capacity is good and hence people with low grades are also eligible to take admission but what's wrong in that? I have seen people with 95% as well as 70% studying together and there is no big deal. Amity’s curriculum is vast, almost 8–10 exams per semester, including a foreign business language which is mandatory. It requires rigorous hard work to compete and 75% attandence is must for giving exams else you will get debarred. One more thing that I like about amity is fully online, as in, all your attandence, marksheets, syllabus, class schedules everything is available online and you don't have to line up in queue to get something done. Amity’s administration is fully online. Though I admit that some policies of amity are completely irritated but in long run we all got used to it. Overall, a good private university which some day will have a great market value. Regards, Proud amitian.

At Amity we are passionate about grooming leaders who are not only thorough professionals but also good human beings with values and sanskars. Placements: Placements at Amity are completely fair and absolutely based on your own devotion to your course. They give you a chance to project yourself in all aspects. Also, there is really hard grooming given for the same so that no student sitting for the placement is left disappointed.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of Amity, Gwalior is really nice. It is a really large campus to hang around in. Every evening walk at Amity gives a refreshing breath of fresh air. The campus is in gwalior and is surrounded by heavy plantation.Faculty: The faculty and course curriculum is really satisfying. It sufficiently prepares you to face the world and the further challenges you get before bagging your dream job. Also, there are behavioural science courses and communication skills courses to enhance you in all aspects to face the world actively in future.Other: It is really exciting to be a part of Amity. You get to enjoy your college life to the fullest and it gets you nearer to your dream job as well. Every event is fun and as exciting as it can be. The crowd is great and cool.

In simple words, it all depends upon you whether you want to study or not. You will find all kinds of students at Amity University, Rich or Middle class, Naughty or Sincere students. You will get all types of friendships. Now you have to decide whether you would like to stay with the students who love to have a balance between studies and fun or who only love to have fun. Most of the teachers at Amity University are from IIT’s or NIT’s or from a very good college, So You don’t have to worry about the teachers. They all are very helpful and also encourages you to do Millenials in your life. I know how to set a balance between fun and studies. Do you? Remember you have all the way to Amity to study and learn for your own good. So analyze people, learn from them and move on. Live your life to the fullest and make your parents proud by your grades and knowledge. Thank you

Amity University Mumbai Campus is one of the finest campuses in Maharashtra with world-class learning infrastructure and over a kilometer long frontage on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. It is designed by globally renowned US architects who have previously designed Boston and California State University. With a well stocked library, ‘air-conditioned’ academic block and 200 Mbps WI-Fi, the campus also includes comfortable cafeterias where students can relax and enjoy! It comprises of world class sports facilities for cricket, football, volleyball, lawn tennis, basketball and badminton. Moreover the campus has a big seminar hall and different laboratories for the students to conduct their experiments. There are several well-appointed residential options for students as well as faculty within its premises. The hostel includes facilities like 200 Mbps Wi-Fi and laundry service for the benefit of the students. The campus is also well-connected by university-operated as well as public transport options from major nearby locations and just 10 km from Panvel station.

I have done my B. tech from Amity University, Amity believes in providing it's students a professional environment and practical experience. Labs for engineering, architecture and biotech students;Media labs for aspiring journalists; Field trips ; Sports programmes and not to forget canteens and cafes to hang out are facilities provided by amity to ease the student's transition into a working individual .There are air conditioned canteens with television. Amity also has a safe friendly environment and a good gender ratio. There are antibulley and women security communities for a safe and free environment . Clubs like litrary club and environment club along with a journal “THE AMITIAN" are part of curriculum where students can explore themselves and execute their ideas. Amity gives you exposure to the outside world as well as prepare you with the competitive world to deal out there. Amity gives you more of practical knowledge and so it is much better than any other college. It has great infrastructure, Faculty, Placement and etc which is required by the students are good. I got placement in a decent company with a good package from Amity.

The University is great. The University upholds the highest ethical values, integrity and professionalism and an unwavering commitment to academic freedom, transparency and accountability. I am studying in Amity Gwalior and the experience has been great so far. Here are few good things about Amity University (Gwalior)- Amity imparts education in almost all areas including management, engineering, biotechnology, law, communication, insurance, nanotechnology, behavioral science, fine arts etc.Air conditioned classrooms to provide adequate comfort level for the students to pursue their studies in the desired environment.Ragging free Campus- University strictly prohibits ragging, let it be in campus or hostel. Students always live in a safe & delightful atmosphere. Several Rules and Regulations are made in order to restrict ragging in the campus.Best infrastructure (according to me), if compared to other colleges in Gwalior.Good Placements , 100% to be more accurate.Good hostel facility which ensures a safe environment for the students.

I have done Mechanical engg from Amity University. Education wise its an average university giving more priority to theoretical knowledge rather than practical. Here, the teachers focuses on assignments and practical file completion which I find absolutely pointless and people tend to copy that and submit thise assignments and practical files.Although Amity has a beautiful library, the ones who want to actually learn and study, its the best place for them. So one can find good education environment in Amity’s library.In terms of placement I would rate Amity high, they are managing well to bring big and renowned companies for the campus placement.

Oh it’s amazing! The university actually everything a student could wish for. Speaking for Amity Gwalior, the past three years have been really splendid! The exposure, the motivation, the support, the love and the kind of education we get at Amity Gwalior is more than sufficient for anyone to succeed in life and do wonders career wise.

I did my engineering in ECE at amity university and i must say that i had a wonderful learning experience there.I studied under very good professors (some of them are IIT ,IIIT,NIT passouts) . So for ECE,I can say that amity is good.

I am a student of Amity Gwalior, so I'll answer how it is like studying there. First, the ambience is ofcourse good. Then about the education- they take it seriously here. You'll be very busy with the assignments, work and classes. 75 percent attendance is mandatory. The faculty is helpful and there's a mentor-mantee programme for the students benefit. The gender ratio is balanced and there are many options for recreational activities like sports and socialising.
